bugs.title: [abrt] xorg-x11-server-Xwayland: free_ei(): Xwayland killed by SIGABRT

bugzilla.short_desc: [abrt] xorg-x11-server-Xwayland: free_ei(): Xwayland killed by SIGABRT

long_desc.thetext:
Version-Release number of selected component:
xorg-x11-server-Xwayland-23.2.1-1.fc40

type:           CCpp
reason:         Xwayland killed by SIGABRT

executable:     /usr/bin/Xwayland
cmdline:        /usr/bin/Xwayland :0 -rootless -noreset -accessx -core -auth /run/user/1000/.mutter-Xwaylandauth.HWHIC2 -listenfd 4 -listenfd 5 -displayfd 6 -initfd 7 -byteswappedclients

uid:            1000
kernel:         6.6.0-0.rc4.20231005git3006adf3be79.36.fc40.x86_64+debug
package:        xorg-x11-server-Xwayland-23.2.1-1.fc40
runlevel:       N 5
backtrace_rating: 4
crash_function: free_ei

 #24 WaitForSomething at ../os/WaitFor.c:195
 #25 Dispatch at ../dix/dispatch.c:487
 #26 dix_main at ../dix/main.c:271

Yeah, I think I know what happens here.
https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/xorg/xserver/-/merge_requests/1178 upstream should fix it.

comment.text: This is working fine for me using Xfce.

long_desc.thetext:
An invalid offset calculation in the XIChangeDeviceProperty/RRChangeOutputProperty may result in an out-of-bounds memory write.

Reference:
https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2023-October/003430.html
